question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will the United States lead the medal count at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if the United States Olympic Team is the sole top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be answered negatively if any team surpasses or matches the US team's ranking.

The medal count is determined by tallying all the medals won by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in 2) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: In the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics, will the men's 100m sprint champion set a new Olympic record by running faster than 9.63 seconds?
question.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100m event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in a time under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Doug Burgum secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Doug Burgum is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate will result in a **No** outcome. The question is open to candidates not currently listed, as additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it is immaterial who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the public" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though a payment might be necessary). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered accessible if more than 50% of the population is able to use it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web platform (excluding the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be considered accessible if the name or site has been altered, provided that OpenAI's service remains largely unchanged (i.e., users can input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US happen within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the peak rate for all three combined, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be calculated based on the week ending dates. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" starting on Sunday and ending on Saturday. The rate considered will encompass all ages, races, and sexes. Refer to the fine print for the correct filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as starting with the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024.

To account for data revisions and reporting delays, the resolution of this question will rely on data available after the reporting delay period, when the current season's figures are no longer shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week ending date.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between China and the Philippines before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, prior to August 1, 2024, any of the following four scenarios occur, based on official announcements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If no such reports are made before this date, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will "Trap" (2024) by M. Night Shyamalan earn a CinemaScore of at least a B?
question.body:
The outcome of this market is YES if "Trap" (2024) achieves a CinemaScore of B or above, and NO if it gets a B- or below. If a CinemaScore is not available for any reason, the result is N/A.

Background:

"Trap" is the forthcoming movie by the renowned director M. Night Shyamalan, which has an impressive trailer.

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent works:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

More examples can be found on the CinemaScore website.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve to **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if not.

"Accessible to the public" means that individuals in the EU, by default, can reach it without using a VPN (though payment might be necessary). If it's inaccessible in some EU nations (similar to Italy's situation in early 2023), or if access is restricted to certain groups (like minors), it will still resolve to YES, provided that over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (excluding the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution remains YES even if the name or URL changes, as long as OpenAI's service fundamentally remains an interface for querying systems powered by Large Language Models.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Is it possible that the US government will discontinue its contract with Verisign for managing the .com domain registry before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or phases out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. If this action is not taken, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: By the end of July 2024, will Joe Biden participate in an on-camera, in-person interview lasting over 45 minutes?
question.body:
The last instance of such an interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes.

If Biden engages in another similar in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market resolves to YES. If no such interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, the market resolves to NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. For instance, a 50 minute video might feature only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed on video.

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will athletes from Russia be prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will be answered as **Yes** if athletes from Russia are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of nations and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or on credible media reports that indicate the 2024 Olympics are proceeding or have concluded without Russian athlete participation. For a **Yes** resolution, no more than 34 Russian athletes may compete in the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 represents 10% of the [Russian athletes who participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics), allowing for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this question will be answered as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be considered ambiguous.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will OpenAI make a public pledge to uphold the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI issues a public pledge to uphold the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement made by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or an interview quote). The statement must reflect a new level of commitment to this principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot merely restate that "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has adopted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus might contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for the resolution of this question to be **Yes**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement gain approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement receives approval in a vote, based on reports from reliable sources.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not advance, the resolution of the question will be **No**.

question.title: H2H - Saratoga July 12th:  Will PIPSY (IRE) finish in front of CLOUDWALKER in the Coronation Cup Stakes?
question.body:
The head-to-head (H2H) horse racing  market closes at the scheduled post time.

 

If there is a dead heat the market resolves to NO.  If either horse scratches the market also resolves to NO.


The market will be resolved with results published at https://www.equibase.com/

question.title: H2H - Saratoga July 12th: Will PIPSY (IRE) outperform CLOUDWALKER in the Coronation Cup Stakes?
question.body:
The head-to-head (H2H) horse racing market concludes at the designated post time.

 

In the event of a tie, the market outcome is NO. If either horse is withdrawn, the market also resolves to NO.


The results will be finalized with the outcomes posted at https://www.equibase.com/

question.title: Will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

question.title: Will Bayern Munich secure the title in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The outcome is "Yes" if Bayern Munich emerges victorious in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). A "No" result applies to all other teams.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden withdraws, will a major news outlet report it at least 6 hours beforehand?
question.body:
The question will resolve as YES if a major and credible news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official dropout announcement through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will resolve as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will result in a **No**. The question is open to potential candidates not yet considered; additional options might be introduced later.

The focus of this question is not on who holds the Republican nomination on the actual day of the 2024 U.S. election; it is exclusively about who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) choose as their nominee.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill presidential duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially determine that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thereby making the Vice President the Acting President.

The length of time for which the incapacity lasts is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar reasons does not qualify. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Is Disney going to unveil a revamped Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if Disney reveals plans for a revamped Peoplemover at the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024, during D23.

For an attraction to qualify as a new version of the Peoplemover, it must be a ride that offers views above Tomorrowland and meets at least two of the following criteria:

1) contains "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) incorporates parts of the existing Peoplemover track structure into the ride

3) reconstructs sections of the Peoplemover track along the same path for the new ride

4) features a station in the former Peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the former Peoplemover station with similar characteristics and location

A YES resolution can occur if a new ride is announced that uses parts of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but it will resolve to NO if an attraction named Peoplemover is announced that is entirely indoors, lacking any aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Biden continue as President until the close of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the close of July 2024 (ET); it resolves as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (which would make his VP the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title: Will UCLA conduct its planned in-person graduation events on June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) successfully conducts all three of its primary in-person college graduation events for the Class of 2024, which are planned for the following times and places on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The events must all take place at the designated venues and commence within 1 hour of their scheduled start times.

This inquiry will resolve as **No** if any event fails to start within an hour of the planned time, is relocated to a different venue, or is conducted entirely online (meaning graduates, faculty, and guests do not attend in person).

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a military operation before midnight ET on August 13th?
question.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation against Israeli land, airspace, or waters from July 30 to August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the answer will be "No".

For this question, a "military operation" is defined as any act of aggression by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or waters (e.g., an Iranian missile striking a weapons facility on Israeli land results in a "Yes") that is either officially recognized by the Iranian government or widely reported by credible sources. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures are excluded from this determination.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are either claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian soil will be considered for this determination. Actions by proxy groups (e.g., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) against Israel will not be included in this determination.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will the peak geomagnetic storm from July 17 to July 28, 2024, have a K-index exceeding 5 but not surpassing 6?
question.body: This question resolves affirmatively if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and does not exceed 6, as per the 30-day historical data provided by the German Research Center for Geosciences.

question.title: Will the peak geomagnetic storm from July 17 to July 28, 2024, have a K-index over 5 but no more than 6?
question.body: This inquiry concludes with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024, inclusive, exceeds 5 and is 6 or lower, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences' 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Trump secure a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat, if Joe Biden is the opponent?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls available, both concluding on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other invites them to vote with a generic Democrat on the same theoretical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are either leading or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the general populace?

This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this calculation for the first poll minus the calculation for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the closing time regardless.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face recorded discussion lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The last eligible interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes.

If Biden engages in another such face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market resolves NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview incorporated into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed face-to-face for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will 20 or more Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden?
question.body:
Background from Politico:

A group of House Democrats is planning to voice opposition to their party's strategy to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, arguing it suppresses the significant current debate about his candidacy, as reported by a participating lawmaker.

A letter draft, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still very concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will settle on YES if a public letter against the early nomination plan has at least 20 signatures from House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters collectively having a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also lead to a YES resolution for this market.

If these conditions are unmet by the market's closure, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Will Disney reveal a revamped Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
The question will be answered YES if Disney declares during the Disney Experiences Showcase at D23 on August 10, 2024, that they are developing a revamped version of the Peoplemover.

To qualify as a revamped Peoplemover, the ride must include segments offering views above Tomorrowland AND meet at least two of the following criteria:

1) the name contains "Peoplemover" or "WEDway"

2) it incorporates parts of the existing Peoplemover track structure

3) it reconstructs sections of the Peoplemover track following the same path for the new ride

4) it features a station located in the former Peoplemover station building

5) it reconstructs the old Peoplemover station maintaining roughly similar features and location

A YES resolution is possible if a new ride incorporating parts of the Peoplemover track and station is announced as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but it would resolve to NO if a Peoplemover-named attraction is announced that is entirely within a show building, lacking aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

The statement can be formal, like a press release, or informal, like a tweet or an interview quote. The statement must reflect a new level of commitment to the principle compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply be a restatement that "we already encourage open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers to determine their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as affirmative as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit for office under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) utilizes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially assert that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thereby appointing the Vice President as Acting President.

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar reasons does not qualify. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

Is it possible that the US government will terminate its contract that directly permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?

This question will be resolved in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or phases out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. If this action does not occur, the question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be accessed on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed reasonably trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market earlier if the outcome is clear and known. You may contact @jskf to request an early resolution or report any issues.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the 2024 film "Twisters" achieve a critics score of 75% or higher on Rotten Tomatoes?
question.body:
This question will be resolved with a YES if the Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score for "Twisters" (2024) is 75% or above, exactly one week following its release on July 26th.

Clarifications:

The score will be taken as it is presented on Rotten Tomatoes, usually without decimal points.

For context, the original "Twister" from 1996 has a current Tomatometer score of 63%, which serves as a comparison.

Although "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for illustration (as it typically requires a Tomatometer score of 75% or more, though there could be additional criteria), the outcome will be determined solely by the score shown.

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the original film from 1996, directed by Lee Isaac Chung, known for "Minari," and featuring actors Glen Powell from "Top Gun: Maverick" and Daisy Edgar Jones from "Normal People."

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit for office under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
The question will be answered with YES if, before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) utilizes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thereby appointing the Vice President as Acting President. 

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar reasons does not qualify. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not qualify.

Background: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit to serve as President under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if, before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another authorized group) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," resulting in the Vice President assuming the role of Acting President.

The length of time for which the President is incapacitated is irrelevant to this question.

The question does not resolve as YES if Biden leaves the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar reasons, nor if he invokes Section 3 of the 25th Amendment.

Context: A Republican lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.body:

- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball

- volleyball
- water polo.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will athletes from Russia be prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games?
question.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if athletes from Russia are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under (i) the Russian national banner, (ii) the banner of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other neutral or independent banner. The resolution will be based on the official roster of nations and athletes at the [2024 Olympic Games](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or on reputable media sources, confirming that the 2024 Olympic Games are in progress or have ended without Russian athletes. For a **Yes** resolution, no more than 34 Russian athletes can participate in the 2024 Olympic Games. The number 34 was selected as 10% of the [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympic Games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympic Games, the answer will be **No**.

If the 2024 Olympic Games are cancelled or delayed to 2025 or later, the question will be resolved as ambiguous.

The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

It is not necessary for Farage to be sworn in as an MP for the inquiry to be resolved with a **Yes** -- the decision is based solely on his election or non-election.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

question.title: Will Kamala Harris Select Kelly or Shapiro as Her VP Choice (YES), or Someone Else (NO)?
question.body:
The leading contenders to join Kamala on the ticket are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports suggest Kamala will make her decision by August 7th.

This question will be answered YES if Kamala Harris officially names either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her vice-presidential choice.

The decision will be based on Kamala’s official announcement. Feel free to comment with any inquiries or updates 💙

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average by 538?
question.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the chart shows Trump leading by 2.4 points over Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the intent of this inquiry.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: In the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 4 but not surpassing 5?
question.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 4 and does not exceed 5, as reported by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US fall within a month of the collective peak for COVID, flu, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This query will be answered as **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season is within 28 days of the date when the combined peak rate for all three occurs, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period is determined based on the week ending dates. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" from Sunday to Saturday. The rate considered will be inclusive of all ages, races, and sexes. Refer to the fine print for appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as starting the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding the week ending June 1, 2024.

To account for data adjustments and reporting delays, the question will be resolved based on data available after the reporting delay period, once the relevant figures for the current season are no longer indicated as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week ending date.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question.title: Will JD Vance utter "Couch" prior to August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly uses the term "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Variations in plural form or possessive of the word will contribute to the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A spoken use of the word "Couch".
-Any written use of the word "Couch" disseminated through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication platforms regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were recorded outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

If more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this inquiry resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Is it expected that Joe Biden will participate in an on-camera, in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes before July 2024 ends?
question.body:
The last interview that met the criteria was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes.

If Biden engages in another similar in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, the outcome will be YES. If no such interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, the outcome will be NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to qualify. A 50 minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed on video.

You can access a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.
