question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

If this does not happen, the outcome will be **No**, unless the election is cancelled or delayed past July 4, 2024, in which case the inquiry will be **nullified**.

The resolution should reference credible media reports from sources such as the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other prominent UK news outlets; or the official declaration by the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate.

Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the inquiry to resolve as **Yes** -- the resolution is based on his election status.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The Philippines recalls any of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels one or more diplomats from the Philippines.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will FiveThirtyEight predict Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Joe Biden is shown to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will resolve to "No" if Donald Trump is shown to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for July 19, 2024. If both Biden and Trump are given equal chances, the market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data points for July 19 once the data points for July 20 are published. The market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest previous data to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to each candidate's winning odds as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be considered.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will a coalition of at least five specific Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
question.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step down publicly. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have told local media they have lost confidence in Biden's chances for the November election.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Several draft letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to cease his campaign, as per five sources acquainted with the situation.

This scenario will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could involve signing a letter as mentioned above or another form of collective action, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to ask him to withdraw.

It is necessary for all five individuals to be part of the same coordinated message. Five individuals separately expressing to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw does not meet the criteria for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step down will not meet the market criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closure date. In any uncertain situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed beyond doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Iranian military action by August 13th midnight ET?
question.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran launches a military operation against Israel's land, air, or sea territories between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM Eastern Time. If not, the market will settle on "No".

For this market's purposes, "military operation" refers to any forceful action carried out by Iran on Israeli land, air, or maritime zones (e.g., if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility on Israeli land, this market will conclude with "Yes") that is either officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or widely reported by credible sources. This encompasses air raids, sea assaults, or land invasions, but excludes cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures.

Only military actions by Iranian troops that are either claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or verified to have been launched from Iranian soil will be considered for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel by affiliated groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will be excluded from this market's determination.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the term "deepfake" be mentioned by Trump, Biden, or a moderator during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, during the live broadcast of the CNN-hosted presidential debate set for June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or any of the moderators mentions the term "deepfake." If none of them do, the answer will be **No**.

The final judgment on whether "deepfake" was mentioned by one of the participants will be made by the Metaculus Admins, whose decision is conclusive. In case of uncertainty, they might refer to CNN's official transcript, which is usually available at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It should be noted, however, that if the word is not clearly mentioned, particularly if it is absent from the transcript, the resolution of the question will be **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on video for at least 45 minutes by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The last eligible interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for about 70 minutes.

If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview lasting a minimum of 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no such interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market resolves NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview incorporated into a program like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be valid. A 50 minute video might only contain 20 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his prior appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the movie "Twisters" (2024) achieve a critics' score of 75% or more on Rotten Tomatoes? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will resolve as YES if the Tomatometer reaches 75% or above, one week post-release (July 26th).

Details

The precision used will be as per Rotten Tomatoes' listing (usually a whole number percentage, no decimal).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) presently holds a Tomatometer score of 63%. This is the type of score I will refer to.

The term "Certified Fresh" is used here for illustration (to my knowledge, it requires a Tomatometer of >=75%, but there may be additional criteria—the market resolves strictly based on the score shown).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone follow-up to the 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.body:

If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview lasting a minimum of 45 minutes, this market resolves as YES. If no suitable interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, the market resolves as NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

question.title: Will Scotland conduct an authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum on its independence from the United Kingdom, and this takes place before May 3, 2024. The referendum can be "advisory," meaning it does not need to have legally binding consequences.

The resolution will not be confirmed by an unauthorized or "Catalan-style" referendum where the UK government has not approved the vote, nor by a vote organized by civic groups. The referendum must have the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.body:

For this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the number shown for July 5 is Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 in the context of this question.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will there be a terrorist incident in mainland France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if a terrorist incident in [Mainland France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the perpetrator(s), within the timeframe from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), inclusive. The conclusion will be No if the specified event does not transpire.

An occurrence will be labeled a 'terrorist incident' if it is identified as such by any French State agency, or by the President of France, the Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

- The Philippines recalls one or more of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels one or more diplomats from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls one or more of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If none of these events are reported by that date, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If no such definitive announcement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Russian athletes are prevented from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have ended without Russian participation. For the inquiry to conclude as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can participate in the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this inquiry resolves as ambiguous.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will a terrorist attack take place in mainland France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist act in [Mainland France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury or death of at least one individual, excluding the perpetrator(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (July 26, 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (August 11, 2024), inclusive. The question will be answered with No if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An incident will be labeled a 'terrorist attack' if it is identified as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Is it expected that Joe Biden will participate in an on-camera interview lasting at least 45 minutes before July 2024 ends?
question.body:
The last interview that met the criteria was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for around 70 minutes.

If Biden engages in another similar in-person interview lasting a minimum of 45 minutes, the outcome of this market will be YES. Should no such interview be released by the end of July, the market will conclude with a NO.

This market excludes events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. However, it does include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews incorporated into programs like 60 Minutes. For these to be valid, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For instance, a 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his prior appearances on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of interview footage.

A list of Biden's interviews along with their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Is Disney set to reveal a revamped Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney declares they are developing a revamped version of the Peoplemover at the D23 Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To qualify as a revamped Peoplemover, the attraction must be a ride that includes aerial views over Tomorrowland AND possesses at least two of the following features:

1) the name includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway"

2) utilizes existing Peoplemover track infrastructure for part of the ride

3) reconstructs sections of the Peoplemover track on the original alignment for the new ride

4) has a station located in the former Peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the former Peoplemover station with roughly similar features and location

This can resolve to YES if a new ride is announced that incorporates portions of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction named Peoplemover is announced that occurs entirely within a show building, without offering aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will the Boeing Starliner leave with the astronauts by July 21?
question.body:
This question mirrors the one found at https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151 in terms of resolution.

The Boeing Starliner, which docked at the International Space Station (ISS) on June 6, 2024, carrying NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, is required to leave within 45 days due to fuel constraints in the Harmony module.

The outcome of this market will be "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft has undocked from the ISS, carrying NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, and commenced its return to Earth by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024.

Departure is defined as the moment the Starliner detaches from the ISS and starts its journey back to Earth.

Official statements from NASA and/or Boeing will serve as the primary sources for resolution, although a consensus from credible news outlets may also be considered.

question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Is Iran going to execute a lethal assault inside Israeli territory by May 1, 2024?
question.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, there are credible reports showing that an attack, credited to Iran and happening within Israel's borders, resulted in the death of at least five people.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Are Russian athletes prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Russian athletes are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the inquiry to be answered with **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be participating in the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this inquiry will be answered with **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this inquiry resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least five specific Democratic House or Senate members urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
question.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already openly suggested Biden should step down. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have told local media they've already given up on Biden's chances in the upcoming November election.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Several drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one reportedly urging Biden to end his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with these actions.

This scenario will be considered YES if a group of at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to reconsider his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, by Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could involve signing a letter similar to the one mentioned, but it might also take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden personally and jointly asking him to withdraw.

All five members must be part of the same group effort. Five individuals independently telling the media they believe Biden should step down does not qualify for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five eligible names are disclosed before the market's closure. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not verified beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions aren't fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams and if the Bucks are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Milwaukee Bucks secure the championship in the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks emerge as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as recognized by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** if any other team wins or if the Bucks fail to win the title.
